params.name: options
params.doc: Options specifying which fields to return.

docs.summary: Gets a category by the specified ID.
description:
The `getCategory()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a category whose ID matches the given ID.

>**Note:** Unless specified in the `options` parameter, the following fields are not included in the response object: `INTERNAL_ID` and `URL`.

examples.title: Get a category by ID with additional fields

params.name: slug
params.doc:
Slug of the category to retrieve.

The end of a category's URL. For example, `https:/example.com/blog/category/{my-category-slug}`. Case sensitive and generally based on the category `label` if not specified.

params.name: options
params.doc: Options specifying which fields to return.

docs.summary: Gets a category by the specified slug.
description:
The `getCategoryBySlug()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a category whose slug matches the given slug.

The `slug` is the end of a category's URL that refers to a specific category. For example, if a category's URL is `https://example.com/blog/category/{my-category-slug}`, the slug is `my-post-slug`. The slug is case-sensitive string that is generally derived from the category's `label`, unless specified otherwise.

>**Note:** Unless specified in the `options` parameter, the following fields are not included in the response object: `INTERNAL_ID` and `URL`.

examples.title: Get a category by its slug
Get a category by slug with additional fields

description: The `listCategories()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a list of up to 100 categories per language in order of their `displayPosition` starting with `'0'`. The `displayPosition` is the position in which the categories are displayed in the Category Menu page. By default, categories get added to the bottom of the Category menu.

examples.title: List blog categories with additional fields and paging options

extra.description: This example uses the `options` parameter to add additional fields and page the blog categories.

docs.summary: Creates a query to retrieve a list of categories.
description: The `queryCategories()` function builds a query to retrieve a list of up to 100 categories per language, and returns a [`CategoriesQueryBuilder`](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-blog-backend/category/categoriesquerybuilder) object.
The returned object contains the query definition, which is typically used to run the query using the `find()` function.

You can refine the query by chaining `CategoriesQueryBuilder` functions to the query. `CategoriesQueryBuilder` functions enable you to sort, filter, and control the results that `queryCategories` returns. The functions that are chained to `queryCategories()` are applied in the order they are called.
`queryCategories` runs with these `CategoriesQueryBuilder` defaults, which you can override.

The following `CategoriesQueryBuilder` functions are supported for `queryCategories()`. For a full description of the `Categories` object, see the object returned for the [`items`](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-blog-backend/category/categoriesqueryresult/items) property in [`CategoriesQueryResult`](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-blog-backend/category/categoriesqueryresult).

examples.title: Retrieve a list of all categories

extra.description: This example uses the `queryCategories()` function to retrieve a list of all categories.

examples.title: Query for a category with multiple queries

extra.description: This example uses the `queryCategories()` function to search for categories in descending order that have a `displayPosition` less than or equal to 2.

members.name: cursor
members.doc: Cursor returned in last query response.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to return. If not set, defaults to 50.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: totalFailures
members.doc: Number of items that couldn't be processed.

members.name: totalSuccesses
members.doc: Number of items that were successfully processed.

members.name: undetailedFailures
members.doc: Number of failures without details because detailed failure threshold was exceeded.

members.name: item
members.doc: Optional created category.

members.name: itemMetadata
members.doc: Bulk actions metadata for category.

members.doc: List of category fields to be included in the response.

members.doc: List of category fields to be included in the response.

members.name: returnFullEntity
members.doc: Whether to return the full created category entities in the response.

members.doc: Category label. Displayed in the Category Menu.

members.name: language
members.doc: Category language. 2-letter code in [ISO 639-1 format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes).

members.doc: Number of posts in the category.

members.name: rank
members.doc: Category position in sequence. Deprecated, use `display_position` instead.

members.doc: SEO data.

members.name: slug
members.doc: Part of a category's URL. For example, 'https:/example.com/blog/category/{my-category-slug}'. Generally based on the category's `label` and case sensitive.

members.name: title
members.doc: Category title.

members.name: translationId
members.doc: ID of the category's translations when [Wix Multilingual](https://wix.wixanswers.com/app/kb/article/36837a9d-5d22-4fa1-9a80-1b99b7f82b5e/en) is installed on a site. All translations of a single category will share the same `translationId`.

members.doc: If `false`, the cover image is the first media item appearing in the content.

members.name: displayed
members.doc: Whether cover media is displayed.

members.name: image
members.doc: Image url.

members.name: video
members.doc: Video url.

members.doc: Image url.

members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.
You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: prev

members.name: _id
members.doc: Item ID. Should always be available, unless it's impossible (for example, when failing to create an item).

members.name: error
members.doc: Details about the error in case of failure.

members.name: originalIndex
members.doc: Index of the item within the request array. Allows for correlation between request and response items.

members.name: success
members.doc: Whether the requested action was successful for this item. When `false`, the `error` field is populated.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: filter
paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

Filter object.
For a detailed list of supported filters, see [Field Support for Filtering and Sorting](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-blog/blog/filter-and-sort).

members.doc: Pagination options.

members.doc: Query options.

members.name: sort
members.doc: Sorting options. For a list of sortable fields, see [Field Support for Filtering and Sorting](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-blog/blog/filter-and-sort).

members.name: categories
members.doc: List of categories.

members.name: metaData
members.doc: Details on the paged set of results returned.

members.name: pagingMetadata
members.doc: Details on the paged set of results returned.

members.name: settings
members.doc: SEO general settings.

members.name: tags
members.doc: SEO tag information.

description:
The SEO schema object contains data about different types of meta tags. It makes sure that the information about your page is presented properly to search engines.
The search engines use this information for ranking purposes, or to display snippets in the search results.
This data will override other sources of tags (for example patterns) and will be included in the <head> section of the HTML document, while not being displayed on the page itself.

members.name: preventAutoRedirect
members.doc: Whether the auto creation of 301 redirects on slug changes is disabled.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.doc: Sort order.

members.name: children
members.doc: SEO tag inner content. For example, `'inner content'` in `<title> inner content </title>`

members.name: custom
members.doc: Whether the SEO tag is a custom tag.

members.name: disabled
members.doc: Whether the SEO tag is disabled.

members.name: meta
members.doc: SEO tag meta data. For example, `{height: 300, width: 240}`.

members.name: props
members.doc: An object of `{"key": "value"}` pairs where the key is one of the SEO tag's properties (name, content, rel, href, etc.) and the value is the value for that property. `{"name": "description", "content": "The description itself."}`.

members.name: type
members.doc: SEO tag type. Supported values: `'title'`, `'meta'`, `'script'`, `'link'`.
